header.topics: Weekend/free time plans, children, cats, hobbies, work
header.activity: Two colleagues having a chat about their work and children.

body.u: have you had a good weekend?
I did yeah I took my children to Forest on Sunday the weather was okay so we got in the car and drove to and it was really nice
oh brilliant so anything else special because it was it was Mother's Day wasn't it?

oh yeah it was Mother's Day yeah my husband cooked he spent all weekend cooking which was supposed to be nice for me but it meant that I did most of the childcare and so that was nice and the girls had bought flowers well you know pretended to buy flowers
aw
and stuff so that was lovely we just
yeah
we just spent the day together you know it was kind of treat because my husband's away quite a lot so what about you?
well you know it was okay sunday was good because basically took away bi on a bike so I had like some extra sleep really and that was nice
oh lovely yeah
yeah he's too little really to do anything else he made me a card at playgroup but that's about all

yeah had made some funny crafts at her school which she was really thrilled with but then she em she gave them to me on Friday after school and she got so excited that she was opening them to show me so she completely missed the point of the gift was for Sunday
which school is that?
it's the one in in
oh right yeah
it's just the mornings it's just morning school so nine till one

that's the same thing as they have in Lode you know where I live so they have a inspired kind of preschool thing and I think yeah I think it's mornings only as well I'd love to eh you know when my son is a bit older I'd like him to go there
yeah I think it's good
yeah do they do anything special there? Anything different?

well I don't really know because I don't pick her up I I only see her at four o'clock so when I get her she's usually forgotten what she's done but when I have visited the impression I get is that it's much more child led so they do what they like they're not going from activity to activity as defined by the teachers you know if they want to do water play all morning they can if they want to play with wooden blocks all morning they can so it's very much just sort of pupil more child-led which I like about it
oh brilliant

Cos she's only three if she wants to play all morning then let her you know that's fine but they do push them a bit more than the other the preschool to you know if they're interested in numbers and letters then they'll let them have a go whereas I think the other preschool in the village tries not to do the stuff that they'll be doing in school

yeah that sounds good I kind of put him on the waiting list for that Lode one and maybe you know I mean you know hopefully by the time he's old enough to go I should be enough spaces for those people who want to go really
yeah what I liked was that em it's smaller so you know there are more staff to children and it's just a bit calmer cos is ever so well she's very mm maybe not highly strung but high maintenance
oh right
she's quite demanding so I think being in a calm environment helps her you know deal with things

well my son actually em I had to take him to the doctors this morning em cos last night he didn't sleep at all because you know he has some sort of rash or something so he spent half the night scratching himself whether it's chicken pox or
it's not chicken pox is it?

I'm not quite sure actually because it's like you know the doctor said it wasn't but we had to go from like one person to another person because they weren't sure and then they gave us like a whole bag of creams and things you know to put on him but he was absolutely fine this morning he was just playing there and just you know having fun really you know wouldn't wouldn't tell that he wasn't sleeping all day whereas in the morning I was like ha ha I want to sleep
oh it's horrible
yeah
chicken pox is going around my girls haven't had it yet but they don't seem to get anything
ah lucky you
so can he go to childcare today?
well he didn't go my mother-in-law has him today because they moved recently they moved to the area recently and so you know we'll see tomorrow anyway
yeah
he normally goes to a child-minder three days a week and to grandparents two days a week so
did you sort out your child-minder problem cos you were looking for someone weren't you?

yeah yeah she was she was okay cos she had to have an operation and then it turned out that I had to have an operation as well because I just had to have emergency surgery with appendicitis and then eh you know he was actually looked after by my mum for a bit and then you know after that he was you know the child-minder was fine again you know she's okay now
okay so you're still using the same person?
yeah well it's kind of handy cos she's only opposite the school literally you know lives opposite the college
yeah perfect
yeah no it's pretty good yeah

mine's not far she's just round the corner from me in but me you know it's just l I try and get there at four o'clock but every night it's five past four ten past four five past four it's really hard there's just so much going on at school that leaving on time is really difficult
how's your day been today?

eh it's been good cos today is an easy day for me I only teach two lessons so I have three frees to get loads of work done usually I'm taken for a couple but today I wasn't but my day started badly because had a tantrum at the child-minders because when we got out of the car she'd lost her bracelet she was wearing a little pink you know silly little jewellery thing and she just went mad completely mad and I had to actually call school to say I may not be in on time because she ran up the road and you know I had to go chasing after her I've got the one year old in the car and the school bags
did you find it in the end or not?
no no I gave her a packet of crisps and that seemed to em fix the problem
oh yeah it was the same thing today at the doctors as well you know a packet of crisps
mm I had to go rifling through my lunchbox what have I got that she likes? Cereal bar? Crisps? Must always have food bribes in the car I'd forgotten that
oh yeah definitely well my husband when he worked in a different school somebody said to him that basically bribery is the basics of today's education
exactly it's teaching and parenting isn't it?
yeah
it's a shame really

Cos the school I used to work at there was a language teacher there who used to when the year elevens did really well at the lesson she used to give them sweets and I kind of found it a bit strange because you know sure year eleven they don't really need things like that

it's ridiculous I mean I just I had two year ten lessons today so these are people who have opted to study German and my objective this year is to try and speak more German in class because that's really tough to get them to do and I'd tried everything and this time I'm giving them raffle tickets every time they say something so I've got a book of raffle tickets every time they say something to me in German I give them a raffle ticket and at the end we have a prize draw and they get a packet of Maltesers
oh brilliant
I mean it's just ridiculous isn't it? They've opted they're doing a GSCE but to get them to speak German which is why they should me in my classroom I actually had to bribe them
that actually works
I have to reward them with bags of chocolate it works but it's wrong
well in in real life nobody will give them Maltesers for speaking German sadly
no exactly but it's the only way I can get to hear them speaking any German and it's the only way they're going to make some progress I've tried the non-chocolate methods

I used to just em when I was doing work experience I was kind of em just assisting really you know the teacher who was you know working with a class who opted to do German and what we did is just take them out of the classroom one by one and just coach them on the questions that would be asked at the exam and as soon as they were out of the classroom just one to one with me for example they were like he he he I don't know anything oh yeah I do actually know this so that kind of thing you know

yeah it's nerve wracking and the thing is the exam has changed now so you can't just drill them in those twenty questions or whatever and hope that you know and ask from that set of questions it's a bit more it has to be a bit more spontaneous now in a way in some ways less but in some ways more so what you really need is for them to have some confidence of doing it by themselves they can do it it's just practice but it takes so much lesson tine just forcing them to say something it's tricky
well I kind of thought the exchange trips are probably incentive enough but they're probably not
I took twenty kids to well seventeen to em to Germany at half term and there's still at least one of those who hasn't said a word of German to me since she got back it comes down to your personality
I know
you're either going to do it or you're not no amount of cajoling with Maltesers or trips is going to change that
I think so and it's also difficult because if you have a class of kids who speak the same language then obviously they would speak the same language to each other
mm

Cos when I was working in the language school I had the same problem erm I mostly taught English to people who were from Germany or Switzerland and because the they were basically you know classes of speakers of the same language
mm
even though I spoke English to them they spoke German between themselves and so it was a really difficult task to get them to speak English including to you know like each other as well
yeah I think the only ways you can do it is by having a mixed nationality class cos then they don't share a common language
yeah erm yeah different
but it it I mean it's obvious you would speak your native language to the person sitting next to you wouldn't you?
mm yeah
it's contrived otherwise
yeah the mixed ones are a lot more fun because erm you know it's it's actually nice to see how they interact with each other and without knowing they actually help each other which which is great
yeah yeah that must be true

even with the normal classes just like you know in mainstream schools er I remember working in a group once in a group with like kids with real low abilities things like that and also there were two girls there one from Thailand and one from Poland and they just put them in the same group and I was just thinking oh how am I going to cope? I mean you know they don't really speak much English neither of them but then you know they were sat together and before too long I just found that they were kind of you know trying to communicate with each oth each other and just helping each other which was brilliant
mm mm mm and then they've got a motivation so they're more likely to make progress
yeah
so were you teaching English as a foreign language?

em I was yeah I was teaching a language school English as a foreign language for couple or years and then after that I was just a teaching assistant in a normal school doing all sorts really but yeah I'm basically CELTA trained
mm
so yeah I trained in that was good fun actually
so that's not TEFL or?
eh it's eh yeah it's it's similar it's a similar thing
what's it called?
CELTA cELTA stands for Certificate of English Language Teaching to Adults
oh Okay
and TEFL is just like a general umbrella term for Teaching English as a Foreign Language
so why aren't you teaching English as a foreign language now? Did you?
mm well there's I just find that it's a bit irregular because the thing is er you depend on people who come from other countries
mm mm
and if they're for example school aged students then you have to wait till they have like a holiday or something like that you know a break from third term
oh I see mm mm

and then so you know some sometimes er sometimes it's really busy like I remember when I lived in Sussex and worked in a language school em summer was really busy Easter was quite busy then in winter there was nothing and so
and actually when you have children that's not what you want you want it to be busy in term time don't you?
no absolutely yeah absolutely yeah but you know it was It was good fun though definitely you know

yeah I'd love to do that actually it must be great to teach language to people who really want to learn it and really need it rather than you know school kind who are just kind of doing it because don't know they need it to perhaps bet on to the next stage of education they might not every use it for real purposes
well actually they're doing this starting this course now for basically an ESL course for you know people who who's English is not you know English is not their first language
are they? Oh wow
yeah they they just literally I think they have an in information evening about that em either today or tomorrow cos Julie asked me to sort something out for it so yeah you might
mm are you going to be teaching?
no no no I'm just sorting out some resources I'm not sure who's meant to be te who's going to be teaching actually
they must have the teacher already I suppose

yeah yeah but it's just a what's happening in the next few days is just like a just like an information really you know for people who are potentially interested there's always stuff like that happening
yeah I could see that being a career move later in life I don't think I can do classroom teaching until I'm sixty-eight or whatever it is we have to be now before we can retire

I can relate to that well my husband can definitely because he's been teaching for thirteen years em and he's a bit kind of tired of it eh he teaches primary and even at primarily he says sometimes it's just too hard so
well primary is busy isn't it? I don't think you get as much free time I mean I get a little bit of free time

and you have to teach everything as well every subject so it's a lot more pressure really on you now and also the expectation expectations I think are quite high because obviously you know the secondary school are like you know small fish big pond whereas there it's like the other way round
yeah where does he teach?
well at the moment in Linton but then it's only a temporary job so from Easter I think he's going to or something
I don't know it
it's a very very small school like a really tiny one
what age does he teach then?
oh just all ages at the moment I think it's year six
okay so the bigger ones
yeah no he doesn't really have much experience with very very young ones you know well neither do I I'm not really into very small kids you know apart from my own you know?
yeah exactly
but it's different when they're your own kids
I don't really like little kids I've just got two of my own
yeah Well you know you know how it is it's like different with your own kids isn't it
oh completely well sometimes I don't know sometimes I'd happily give Ella up for adoption like this morning
yeah have you got any plans for Easter yet? Easter holidays

yeah we're going to go to em Italy for a week because my husband's mum and dad have a house in Tuscany so it sounds more glamorous than it is it's in the middle of nowhere em but it's nice because it's not touristy you know Tuscany can be a bit touristy but em this is up in the hills somewhere and we have to go down a stony ungravelled road just to even get to a real road so it's very it is very quiet it's very peaceful and we don't do much whilst we're there
sounds good
yeah it will be good cos this time which is unusual my my mum and dad are going to come to so 's parents my parents us and the girls my two girls so
sounds interesting but busy

A full house yeah it will be busy I mean I'll still have a few days either side to get work done and do a bit of gardening hopefully my garden looks like oh I don't know war zone it's just overgrown and brambly and you know the cats have been digging it up it just looks horrible I really need to get out there
is it's a very big garden?

it it's biggish em we've got a front garden which is all the problem is it's all planted so it needs to be taken care of em we inherited it it's quite a mature garden and there's a very big vegetable garden em at the end so it's just lots of work it's like having an allotment and and a garden and we don't have that much time cos we've got the two little ones so I think I might have to ring the man in the village who comes and helps me now and again and see if he can do some digging
yeah
but yeah what about you?

well my my in-laws are actually working hard on their garden cos they just literally moved into their new house and there's a lot of work cos it's a bigger house than the one they use to have with a bigger garden as well but our garden isn't really that big it's just kind of you know average size really em and we have an allotment as well cos most people in Lode have an allotment
oh do they?
so but it's mostly my husband who goes there and does things there really you know?
I'm amazed he finds the time I mean we se find it so difficult
that's because he gets up at like half five
he goes in the morning
he yeah even at the weekend he just it's just what he does you know? He's he's a very every early bird it's like literally you know he even when he doesn't have to go anywhere you know
oh really
yeah he just gets up at half five you know? Does his stuff you know
yeah I live my life wondering when my next lie in might come from
I can relate to that definitely

I didn't even have one on Sunday cos I I'd slept in a bi on Saturday and Matt got up with eh girls and then on Sunday which was mother's day at then to six when my girls woke up I was on duty so that didn't seen quite right
well I'm just definitely looking forward to a time when eh my son is a teenager and he eh from what I heard they sleep most of the time
yeah I think so
sounds good so I can sleep as well
I'm looking forward to that too and then when they get up you don't need to be there to give them their cornflakes
ah seriously why do people complain about having teenagers I really don't know oh lovely life
it is hard though isn't it with little ones? Working and having little ones just em is very full on

yeah definitely and I try to do other things as well you know and eh you know I used to do workshops em every literally you know nearly every Saturday as well as working full time em it was a bit difficult so I kind of decided to set myself a rule not to do you know more than one workshop a month
mm so what do you do is it like crafts or?
it's eh it's yeah just art workshops you know just teach how how to draw Manga
oh you teach the Manga? Okay
yeah yeah so yeah I had a nice one in over the half term and so the next one will be I think the first Saturday of Easter holiday
oh lovely where where do you do that? Always in the same place or?

no no no all over the place really in different libraries and different schools and things I've I've done most schools in the area most libraries most libraries in the last one was at the University of and then eh I do eh bookshops you know bookshops as well so yeah cos they do demonstrations and things like that so yeah it's just just like another thing I do really
oh wow I didn't know that
yeah
secrets
I know
so how did you learn to draw Manga? Was it just an interest or?

well it was initially you know I I just kind of got into it when I was about twelve and then cos I always loved drawing and I kind of thought well you know because I like the style I might as well you know try and draw in that style and then so eh later on I kind of decided to you know get in to it semi-professionally and I got my first book published in 2010 and my second book soon after that as well
oh really? Do you write as well as illustrate or?

eh yeah yeah I mean the the one that's in the pipeline now go going to be published in July that was written and illustrated by me and about three other artists it's like an instructional book about how to draw Manga
oh I see
it was a lot of work so yeah
oh wow
but hopefully now when it's when it's done you know hopefully it will it will look good
that's amazing you should bring a copy in so we can have a look
yeah no I'm definitely going to
do you like the Japanese anime films?
yeah yeah I love them
yeah me too
oh brilliant
I just watched them with a couple of weeks ago Howl's Moving Castle have you seen that one?
ah yeah yeah
so good we watched it twice we were just so pleased with it
yeah they're good for em the children to watch really and there those those particular classic ones you know so yeah no it's a good thing to get into
yeah we thought it was a great story I'm going to try and buy the book cos it's em a Diana Wynne Jones book isn't it?
I think so yeah?
well she was a I don't think she's alive anymore
okay
are we done?
yeah
